00046 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00047                                                unsigned long uld,
00048                                                unsigned long *r)
00049 {
00050     unsigned long long q, rf;
00051     unsigned long qh, rh, ql, qf;
00052     
00053     q = 0;
00054     rf = (unsigned long long)(0xFFFFFFFF - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFF / uld) * uld) + 1ULL;
00055     
00056     while (ull >= uld) 
00057         {
00058         ((unsigned long *)&q)[0] += (qh = ((unsigned long *)&ull)[0] / uld);
00059         rh = ((unsigned long *)&ull)[0] - qh * uld;
00060         q += rh * (unsigned long long)qf + (ql = ((unsigned long *)&ull)[1] / uld);
00061         ull = rh * rf + (((unsigned long *)&ull)[1] - ql * uld);
00062         }
00063 
00064     if (r)
00065         *r = ull;
00066 
00067     return q;
00068 }
00069 
00070 #define rthal_uldivrem(ull,ul,rp) ((u_long) rthal_ulldiv((ull),(ul),(rp)))
00071 
00072 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(unsigned long m0, 
00073                                               unsigned long m1)
00074 {
00075     unsigned long long res;
00076     
00077     __asm__ __volatile__ ("mulhwu %0, %1, %2"
00078                           : "=r" (((unsigned long *)&res)[0]) 
00079                           : "%r" (m0), "r" (m1));
00080 
00081     ((unsigned long *)&res)[1] = m0*m1;
00082     
00083     return res;
00084 }
00085 
00086 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00087 
00088     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00089     
00090     unsigned long q, r;
00091     q = rthal_ulldiv(rthal_ullmul(i, mult), div, &r);
00092     return (r + r) > div ? q + 1 : q;
00093 }
00094 
00095 static inline unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd(unsigned long long ll,
00096                                                int mult,
00097                                                int div) {
00098 
00099     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00100 
00101     unsigned long long low;
00102     unsigned long q, r;
00103     
00104     low  = rthal_ullmul(((unsigned long *)&ll)[1], mult);       
00105     q = rthal_ulldiv(rthal_ullmul(((unsigned long *)&ll)[0], mult) + 
00106                      ((unsigned long *)&low)[0], div, (unsigned long *)&low);
00107     low = rthal_ulldiv(low, div, &r);
00108     ((unsigned long *)&low)[0] += q;
00109     
00110     return (r + r) > div ? low + 1 : low;
00111 }
00112 
00113 static inline long long rthal_llimd (long long op,
00114                                      unsigned long m,
00115                                      unsigned long d) {
00116 
00117     if(op < 0LL)
00118         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00119     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00120 }

00122 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00123 
00124     __asm__ __volatile__ ("cntlzw %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00125     return 31 - ul;
00126 }

00166 #define rthal_cli()                     adeos_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00167 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00168 #define rthal_local_irq_save(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00169 #define rthal_local_irq_restore(x)      adeos_restore_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain,(x))

00188 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00189 
00190     rthal_cli();
00191     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00192 }
00193 
00194 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00195 
00196     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00197     rthal_sti();
00198 }

00200 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00201 
00202     unsigned long flags;
00203     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00204     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00205     return flags;
00206 }

00208 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00209                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00210     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00211     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);

00214 #if !defined(CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS)
00215 
00216 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00217    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00218    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00219    instead. */
00220 
00221 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00222     return ((struct thread_info *)(adp_root->esp[cpuid] & (~8191UL)))->task;
00223 }
00224 
00225 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00226 
00227 {
00228     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00229     /* FIXME: r2 should be ok or even __adeos_current_threadinfo() - offsetof(THREAD) */
00230     
00231     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 8192)
00232         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00233 
00234     return current;
00235 }
00236 
00237 #else /* CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00238 
00239 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00240     return current;
00241 }
00242 
00243 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid) {
00244     return current;
00245 }
00246 
00247 #endif /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */

00249 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00250 
00251     if (delay) {
00252 #ifdef CONFIG_40x
00253         mtspr(SPRN_PIT,delay);
00254 #else /* !CONFIG_40x */
00255         set_dec(delay);
00256 #endif /* CONFIG_40x */
00257     }
00258 }

00277 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU

00279 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00280     
00281     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00282        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00283        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00284        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/fpu.S). */
00285 
00286     double fpr[32];
00287     unsigned long fpscr_pad;    /* <= Hi-word of the FPR used to */
00288     unsigned long fpscr;        /* retrieve the FPSCR. */
00289 
00290 } rthal_fpenv_t;
